title: White Spruce (Picea glauca – ×lutzii)
name: white spruce
rationale: LightGBM provided the best quantitative performance.
description: The white spruce diagnostic species set consists of Picea glauca (Moench) Voss and Picea ×lutzii Little, a fertile hybrid between Picea glauca and Picea sitchensis (Bong.) Carrière. Picea glauca is common and widespread throughout the boreal bioclimatic zone of the map domain. Picea ×lutzii is common in the Kenai Mountains at the transition between the boreal and temperate bioclimatic zones. Picea ×lutzii is also known from several locations in Lake Clark National Park in Southwest Alaska. We merged Picea ×lutzii with Picea glauca because our models were not able to reliably distinguish the between the two and the distinction can be difficult to make in the field.
